org.jpws.front

Class DisplayManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpws.front.DisplayManager

  • public final class DisplayManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to organise global display arrangements.

    Events
    The class fires events of type javax.swing.event.ChangeEvent under following conditions (not fully implemented!):
    - when a file or element is added to or removed from the Desktop
    - when selection of elements (e.g. containers) changes
    - when quality changes from NO-MODIFIED to MODIFIED files
    - when quality changes from MODIFIED to NO-MODIFIED file
    - when an editor of content elements has started or terminated

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init()

      • checkMirrorActivity

        public static boolean checkMirrorActivity()
        Triggers off mirror save activity on every open database file which is under administration of the display manager. Files get saved to mirrors in case they were modified. If any save operation fails, false is returned.
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if all modified files were saved

      • exit

        public static void exit()
        Checks through every open database file under administration of the display manager. Files get saved to mirrors in case they were modified. If any save operation fails, false is returned.

      • getFirstContainer

        public static PwsFileContainer getFirstContainer()
        Returns the first (=latest used) PwsFileContainer from the desktop set of windows or null if no file is loaded.
        Returns:
        PwsFileContainer or null

      • createEmptyScreen

        public static javax.swing.JPanel createEmptyScreen()
        Creates and returns a standard empty screen panel with BorderLayout. The panel may contain decorations to the season if this option is set in preferences and the time is right.
        Returns:
        JPanel

      • getDisplayState

        public static int getDisplayState()
        Returns the current principal display modus.
        Returns:
        DISPLAY_DESKTOP or DISPLAY_SINGLE

      • isDesktopView

        public static boolean isDesktopView()
        Whether the current display modus is DISPLAY_DESKTOP.

      • getFileContainer

        public static PwsFileContainer getFileContainer(org.jpws.pwslib.global.UUID id)
        Returns the file container identified by the parameter file UUID value or null if this ID is unknown in the JPWS desktop.
        Parameters:
        id - UUID file UUID
        Returns:
        PwsFileContainer or null

      • getContainerIterator

        public static java.util.Iterator<PwsFileContainer> getContainerIterator()
        Returns an Iterator over all PwsFileContainer objects that are currently represented in the Desktop.
        Returns:
        Iterator over type PwsFileContainer

      • hasDatabase

        public static boolean hasDatabase(org.jpws.pwslib.global.UUID id)
        Whether the given UUID denotes a database which is represented in the the display manager (i.e. has a GUI window).
        Parameters:
        id - UUID of database
        Returns:
        boolean

      • isRegisteredFile

        public static boolean isRegisteredFile(org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile f)
        Whether the parameter file is the persistent state of a file container currently registered in this display manager. null parameter returns false.
        Parameters:
        f - ContextFile; may be null

      • getFileContainer

        public static PwsFileContainer getFileContainer(org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile f)
        Returns the file container identified by the parameter context file or null if unknown in the desktop.
        Parameters:
        f - ContextFile database file
        Returns:
        PwsFileContainer or null

      • setDisplayState

        public static boolean setDisplayState(int state)
        Attempts to sets the principal display modus. The operation may fail if display manager finds it impossible (e.g. failing file save).
        Parameters:
        state - DISPLAY_DESKTOP or DISPLAY_SINGLE
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if the requested state has been established

      • getActivationState

        public static int getActivationState(PwsFileContainer ct)
        Returns the current activation state of the parameter file container in the JPWS desktop.
        Parameters:
        ct - PwsFileContainer desktop container to be evaluated
        Returns:
        int one of STATE_ACTIVE, STATE_INACTIVE, STATE_ICONIFIED
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameter is not a registered element of the desktop

      • requestActivationState

        public static boolean requestActivationState(PwsFileContainer ct,
                                             int state)
        Requests the display manager to establish a specific activation state for the parameter file container in the GUI. The parameter has to be already a registered element of the JPWS desktop. Activation may deactivate other desktop elements. The request can be denied if the requested state conflicts with ongoing operations in the GUI.
        Parameters:
        ct - PwsFileContainer desktop container to be activated
        state - int one of STATE_ACTIVE, STATE_INACTIVE, STATE_ICONIFIED
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if the requested activation has been performed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameter is not a registered element of the desktop

      • isRegisteredContainer

        public static boolean isRegisteredContainer(PwsFileContainer ct)
        Whether the parameter file container is registered in the display manager. (null returns false.)
        Parameters:
        ct - PwsFileContainer; may be null
        Returns:
        boolean

      • registerContainer

        public static boolean registerContainer(PwsFileContainer file)
        Attempts to add a file container to the JPWS desktop. After registration, if it is the first element of the desktop, or if there is no other element currently active, the parameter will be activated, otherwise it will be deactivated. If the desktop cannot hold another element, this registration fails by returning false.
        Parameters:
        ct - PwsFileContainer to be added
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if the requested registration has been performed

      • saveAll

        public static void saveAll()
        Saves all modified databases which are open in the desktop.

      • emergencySave

        public static boolean emergencySave()
        Triggers off emergency save action on every open database file which is under administration of the display manager. Files get saved in case they were modified, without dialog to the user. If any save operation fails, false is returned.
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if all modified files were saved

      • closeAll

        public static boolean closeAll()
        Closes all elements in the JPWS desktop and removes their views. The operation may be interrupted by user action or IO failure.
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if all elements were removed

      • closeAllBut

        public static boolean closeAllBut(PwsFileContainer ct)
        Closes all containers in JPWS desktop except the one specified as parameter.
        Parameters:
        ct - PwsFileContainer or null for closing all
        Returns:
        boolean true == all requested files closed, false == some closings broken

      • closeForOne

        public static boolean closeForOne()
        Requests the display manager to make room for one additional container to get registered. This may trigger closing of an open desktop element in case the desktop has reached its capacity.
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if there is room for another container in desktop

      • getSelectedContainer

        public static PwsFileContainer getSelectedContainer()
        Returns the currently activated file container in the JPWS desktop or null if no container is active.
        Returns:
        PwsFileContainer or null

      • hasSelectedFile

        public static boolean hasSelectedFile()
        Whether there is a file container currently active (selected) in the JPWS desktop.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • hasOpenFiles

        public static boolean hasOpenFiles()
        Whether there are file containers registered in the JWPS desktop.
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if there is at least one file container registered in the display manager

      • hasModifiedFiles

        public static boolean hasModifiedFiles()

      • getFileCount

        public static int getFileCount()
        Returns the actual number of database files open in the desktop, regardless of the actual display modus (SINGLE or DESKTOP).
        Returns:
        int number of open files

      • addChangeListener

        public static void addChangeListener(javax.swing.event.ChangeListener li)

      • removeChangeListener

        public static void removeChangeListener(javax.swing.event.ChangeListener li)

      • getFont

        public static java.awt.Font getFont(java.lang.String name)
        Returns a font identified by a canonical name or that has been previously stored by method setFont. If the name is a canonical JPWS application font name, a valid font is guaranteed to be returned. Canonical names are: menu, data, password, notes, display, control, tooltip.
        Parameters:
        name - name of application font
        Returns:
        Font or null if and only if the name is unknown

      • getDefaultFont

        public static java.awt.Font getDefaultFont(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the default JPWS font for the parameter canonical font name.
        Parameters:
        name - canonical name of JPWS font
        Returns:
        Font

      • setFont

        public static void setFont(java.lang.String name,
                           java.awt.Font font)
        Stores a font for a given name. If the name is one of the canonical application font names, the corresponding displays are set to adopt the given font. Canonical names are: menu, data, password, notes, display, control, tooltip.
        Parameters:
        name - token for the given font
        font - Font

      • storeFont

        public static void storeFont(java.lang.String name,
                             java.awt.Font font)
        Stores a font with the specified name into global persistent options.
        Parameters:
        name - name of font
        font - Font

      • fontCode

        public static java.lang.String fontCode(java.awt.Font font)
        Returns a definition text for the given font.
        Parameters:
        font - font to be represented
        Returns:
        font text representation or null if font == null
